alert.note: Alert for Marinette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 8:36PM CDT until April 25 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Pine River near Florence affecting Florence County. Menominee River near McAllister affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Niagara affecting Florence, Marinette, Dickinson and Menominee Counties. Peshtigo River near Porterfield affecting Marinette County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Menominee River near Koss affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Vulcan affecting Marinette, Dickinson and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Florence affecting Florence, Dickinson and Iron Counties. For the Menominee River...including Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain, Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, Pembine, Menominee River at White Rapids Dam, Koss, McAllister...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near McAllister. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, flood waters are covering River Drive and Shore Drive west of Wallace in Menominee County, Michigan and South Park Road east of Porterfield in Marinette County. This stage compares to a flow of 24240 cubic feet per second at White Rapids Dam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning and continue falling to 14.5 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.
